Tree | blank1_info_sec1 = Ginkgo | blank2_name_sec1 = - Flower | blank2_info_sec1 = Cosmos | blank3_name_sec1 = - Bird | blank3_info_sec1 = Japanese Bush-warbler | blank4_name_sec1 = | blank4_info_sec1 = | blank5_name_sec1 = | blank5_info_sec1 = | blank6_name_sec1 = | blank6_info_sec1 = | blank7_name_sec1 = | blank7_info_sec1 = | blank_name_sec2 = Phone number | blank_info_sec2 = 0436-22-1111 | blank1_name_sec2 = Address | blank1_info_sec2 = 1-1-1 Kokubunjidai Chūō, Ichihara-shi, Chiba-ken 290-8501 | website = City of Ichihara | footnotes = }} is a Japanese city in Chiba Prefecture on the island of Honshū.Whitney, Willis Norton. (1889). Concise Dictionary of the Principal Roads, Chief Towns and Villages of Japan, p. 210. ==History== Ichihara is in the area of ancient Kazusa province.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Kazusa" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 502. ===2011 earthquake=== On Friday, March 11, 2011, the Tōhoku earthquake caused damage in Ichihara. Natural gas storage tanks were set on fire by the earthquake."Japan earthquake causes oil refinery inferno" . Daily Telegraph (UK), 11 March 2011; . AlertNet, "Natural gas storage tanks burn at Cosmo oil refinery in Ichihara city" , 11 March 2011; retrieved 2012-3-22. ==Geography== Ichihara is on the east coast of Toyko bay._____. (2003). "Ichihara," Encyclopedia Britannica (2006), Vol. 6, p. 235. In other words, it is on the west coast of Bōsō Peninsula.US War Dept. (1945). Civil affairs handbook, Japan. Prefectural Studies: Volume 5, p. 87. ==Related pages== * JEF United Ichihara Chiba == References == ==Other websites== * Ichihara website Category:Cities in Chiba Prefecture
title: Ichihara, Chiba
